attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Sanitary wear is classed as a luxury in England and so VAT is applied.
Women do not choose to menstruate, therefore sanitary items are a NECESSITY.

Even though the levy was reduced from 17.5% to a 'reduced rate' of 5% in 2001, it still constitutes tampons and towels as luxury items and amounts to a tax on being female.

Asda has taken it upon themselves to absorb the VAT on sanitary wear so their customers pay less for these unavoidable monthly expenses; but why should they?

Change the title of sanitary wear to necessity NOT luxury and make them Zero Rated!
